snippet: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei’s remarks were his first response to President Obama’s speech last week asserting that military force is not always the answer.
abstract: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran's supreme leader, asserts that the Obama administration has taken the option of military intervention to resolve conflicts off the table; remarks amount to his first public reaction to Pres Obama’s West Point commencement speech in which he held that the United States has other ways of carrying out foreign policy besides military force.
lead_paragraph: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei’s remarks were his first response to President Obama’s speech last week asserting that military force is not always the answer.

headline.main: Iran’s Leader Says Obama Has Removed Military Option
headline.print_headline: Iran’s Leader Says Obama Has Removed Military Option
